text: When there are new releases, do you try to build for armv7l or you simply gave up?  for example, v1.5.4 reportedly builds for that platform: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/bring-julia-code-to-embedded-hardware-arm/19979/59>

attachments.title: Bring Julia code to embedded hardware (ARM)
attachments.text: Julia v1.5.4 does compile from source. I expect v1.6.1 to compile with the backport of Fix armv7l trampoline by staticfloat · Pull Request #40176 · JuliaLang/julia · GitHub already merged. Issue armv7l - No loaded BLAS libraries were built with LP64 support · Issue #40199 · JuliaLang/julia · GitHub prevents building current master. I will continue to test and report issues.
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Bring Julia code to embedded hardware (ARM)

elements.text: When there are new releases, do you try to build for armv7l or you simply gave up?  for example, v1.5.4 reportedly builds for that platform:

text: Do we have any Julia Buildbots for that platform? <@U66GD0880>

elements.text: Do we have any Julia Buildbots for that platform?

text: We do but the builds never pass

elements.text: We do but the builds never pass

text:
I’ve created Julia v1.5.4 binary for armv7l

```JL_VERSION=v1.5.4
IMAGE_NAME=terasakisatoshi/jlcross:rpi3-${JL_VERSION}
CONTAINER_NAME=jltmp_${JL_VERSION}
docker run --name ${CONTAINER_NAME} $IMAGE_NAME /bin/bash
docker cp ${CONTAINER_NAME}:/home/pi/julia-${JL_VERSION} .
docker rm ${CONTAINER_NAME}
scp -r julia-v1.5.4 pi@raspberrypi:work
ssh pi@raspberry
cd work/julia-v1.5.4/bin
./julia
               _
   _       _ _(_)_     |  Documentation: <https://docs.julialang.org>
  (_)     | (_) (_)    |
   _ _   _| |_  __ _   |  Type "?" for help, "]?" for Pkg help.
  | | | | | | |/ _` |  |
  | | |_| | | | (_| |  |  Version 1.5.4 (2021-03-11)
 _/ |\__'_|_|_|\__'_|  |
|__/                   |

julia> versioninfo()
Julia Version 1.5.4
Commit 69fcb57* (2021-03-11 19:13 UTC)
Platform Info:
  OS: Linux (arm-linux-gnueabihf)
  CPU: ARMv7 Processor rev 3 (v7l)
  WORD_SIZE: 32
  LIBM: libopenlibm
  LLVM: libLLVM-9.0.1 (ORCJIT, cortex-a72)```

elements.text: I’ve created Julia v1.5.4 binary for armv7l

ssh pi@raspberry
cd work/julia-v1.5.4/bin
./julia
